intro: Leucas mildbraedii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. Leucas mildbraedii is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
